comments:
When attempting to create a new web service, at the point of the wizard where
you select which server to deploy to, if you click "Next" you receive this error
text.

This happens regardless of what java project I attempt to wrap.  I am using java
sdk  1.4.2_09.

Source code used when this error was generated:

package com.fierymoon;

public class TestClass {
	public int theAnswerIs() {
		return 42;
	}
}

Peter,

It's best to have JEM look at how they are using EMF.  Looks like they probably
have a resource with a null URI.

JEM doesn't produce a resource with a null URI. At least it has not done so in
any of our tests or usages so far.

I'm turning it over to WTP to see if they are producing the resource with a null
uri, i.e. some code explicitly added a resource to the project resource set but
did not set its URI. 

Since WTP has the code to reproduce this (its a web service) and JEM doesn't,
they can reproduce this and see what resource has the null URI. If it is a JEM
resource, then the defect can be returned to JEM.

I've tried this in WTP 1.0 and cannot reproduce the problem. Could you please try your scenario on 1.0 (or one of the 1.5 RC builds)? Nake sure the Java class (TestClass) is loadable from the context of the Web project in which you trying to deploy your Web service. Creating your Java class in a Web project instead of in a Java project is the easiest way to insure this.
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
